verbs.description: privatize (third-person singular simple present privatizes, present participle privatizing, simple past and past participle privatized) (American spelling, Oxford British English)

entries.meaning: (economics) To release government control (of a business or industry) to private industry.
(computing, transitive) To render (a variable, etc.) private in scope.
examples: If the compiler allocates a privatized variable to a register, it must examine whether the variable is live after the termination of the while-loop.

entries.meaning: (transitive, uncommon) To render a thought or an idea, private in scope.
